# Report Template

## Standard Reporting Structure

## Template

```markdown
---
title: [Report Title]
date: [YYYY-MM-DD]
author: [Author Name]
classification: [Internal/Client/Public]
---

# [Report Title]

**Date:** [Date]  
**Author:** [Author]  
**Classification:** [Internal/Client/Public]

---

## Executive Summary

[2-3 paragraph summary of key findings and recommendations. Busy executives should get everything they need from this section.]

**Key Findings:**
- [Finding 1]
- [Finding 2]
- [Finding 3]

**Recommendations:**
- [Recommendation 1]
- [Recommendation 2]
- [Recommendation 3]

---

## 1. Introduction

### 1.1 Background

[Context and why this report exists]

### 1.2 Objectives

[What this report aims to achieve]

### 1.3 Methodology

[How data was collected and analysed]

---

## 2. Findings

### 2.1 [Finding Category 1]

[Detailed findings with supporting data]

| Metric | Value | Benchmark | Status |
|--------|-------|-----------|--------|
| [Metric 1] | [Value] | [Benchmark] | [Good/Bad/Neutral] |
| [Metric 2] | [Value] | [Benchmark] | [Good/Bad/Neutral] |

### 2.2 [Finding Category 2]

[Detailed findings]

```
[Code block or data excerpt if relevant]
```

### 2.3 [Finding Category 3]

[Detailed findings]

---

## 3. Analysis

[Interpretation of findings — what do they mean?]

### 3.1 [Analysis Point 1]

[Explanation]

### 3.2 [Analysis Point 2]

[Explanation]

---

## 4. Recommendations

### 4.1 [Recommendation 1]

**Priority:** [High/Medium/Low]  
**Owner:** [Name]  
**Timeline:** [When]

[Detailed recommendation with expected outcome]

### 4.2 [Recommendation 2]

[Same structure]

### 4.3 [Recommendation 3]

[Same structure]

---

## 5. Next Steps

| Action | Owner | Due Date | Status |
|--------|-------|----------|--------|
| [Action 1] | [Owner] | [Date] | [Pending] |
| [Action 2] | [Owner] | [Date] | [Pending] |
| [Action 3] | [Owner] | [Date] | [Pending] |

---

## Appendix

### A. Data Sources

[List of data sources]

### B. Methodology Details

[Detailed methodology if needed]

### C. Glossary

| Term | Definition |
|------|------------|
| [Term 1] | [Definition] |
| [Term 2] | [Definition] |

---

**Document Control**

| Version | Date | Author | Changes |
|---------|------|--------|---------|
| 1.0 | [Date] | [Author] | Initial version |
```

## Report Types

### Workflow Audit Report

```markdown
---
title: Workflow Audit: [Client Name]
date: 2024-01-15
author: 162 Team
classification: Client
---

# Workflow Audit: [Client Name]

## Executive Summary

We analysed [Client]'s AI workflows and identified [X] opportunities for improvement...

## Current State

[Map of existing workflows]

## Gaps Identified

| Gap | Impact | Priority |
|-----|--------|----------|
| [Gap 1] | [Impact] | High |

## Recommendations

[Specific, actionable recommendations]

## Implementation Roadmap

[Timeline and milestones]
```

### Monthly Performance Report

```markdown
---
title: Monthly Performance Report: [Month Year]
date: 2024-02-01
author: 162 Team
classification: Internal
---

# Monthly Performance Report: [Month Year]

## Executive Summary

[High-level performance summary]

## Key Metrics

| Metric | Target | Actual | Variance |
|--------|--------|--------|----------|
| Revenue | £X | £Y | Z% |
| New Clients | X | Y | Z% |
| Churn | X% | Y% | Z% |

## Highlights

[Major wins]

## Challenges

[Issues faced]

## Next Month

[Priorities and goals]
```

## Formatting Guidelines

### Tables

Use tables for:
- Metrics and comparisons
- Action items
- Timelines
- Status updates

### Charts

Include charts for:
- Trends over time
- Comparisons
- Distributions

### Code Blocks

Use for:
- Configuration examples
- Data excerpts
- Technical details

## Checklist

- [ ] Executive summary is complete
- [ ] Findings supported by data
- [ ] Recommendations are actionable
- [ ] Next steps have owners and dates
- [ ] Appendices included if needed
- [ ] Proofread for typos
- [ ] Classification marked
